document.masterDocTitle: A review of the whitefly genus Aleurocanthus Quaintance & Baker (Hemiptera: Aleyrodidae) in Australia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the whitefly genus Aleurocanthus Quaintance & Baker (Hemiptera: Aleyrodidae) in Australia

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Aleurodes spinifera Quaintance 1903 : 63
–64. Lectotype Java, designated by
Martin 1999
: 29
( USNM )
Aleurocanthus spiniferus (Quaintance)
, Quaintance & Baker , 1914 : 102 .

subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution. Australia – Qld, NT and likely to be present in NE NSW . Elsewhere widely distributed – Palearctic, Malagasian, Ethiopian, Oriental, SE Asian and Pacific regions (
Martin, 1999
;
Mound & Halsey, 1978
) Hosts. Many samples taken from
Annona
spp., see list in Table 1 .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 73–77.
A. spiniferus
: 73, puparia habitus; 74, puparium habitus; 75, adult male; 76, puparium slide; 77, illustration (from Martin 1999).

subSubSection.paragraph: Comments. This species is a common species in coastal Queensland and sometimes forms densely populated conspicuous colonies and can become a pest of some crops and ornamental plants. This highly polyphagous rainforest species has been recorded from a number of new native and ornamental hosts. Often recorded from roses elsewhere, the species has not yet been recorded on roses in Australia . Features outlined in the key should readily separate this species from other Australian species.
